newsitem.title: JAPAN: FORECAST-Analysts divided on Japan Jan trade data.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Analysts divided on Japan Jan trade data.

text.p: Economists are deeply divided in their forecasts for Japan"s customs-cleared trade balance in January, with some expecting the first rise in the surplus for more than two years and others predicting a trade deficit.
Economists" forecasts for the January trade surplus ranged from a deficit of 190 billion yen to a surplus of 150 billion yen, compared with a surplus of 61.2 billion yen in January, 1996.
Japan"s trade surplus fell for a 25th straight month in December on a year-on-year basis.
January figures are due to be announced on Wednesday.
Economists said January trade figures are a poor guide to changes in Japan"s trade pattern since they vary widely depending on when companies resume work after the New Year holidays.
This year, there were five consecutive days of holidays, whereas last year the five days of holidays were broken up by a weekend.
"Exports were concentrated in the last 10 days of January, and it is difficult to predict the amount in the period," an economist at a major research institute said.
In the first 10 days of January, Japan posted a trade deficit of 350.68 billion yen, compared with a deficit of 284.28 billion yen in the same period a year earlier.
Economists who predicted a continued decline in Japan"s trade surplus said the value of imports in January was high as the weak yen pushed up overall import prices.
Looking ahead, economists said they expect the yen"s weakening since mid-1995 to help boost exports, while discouraging imports, eventually causing a halt in the trend of a declining surplus.
Forecasts by individual research firms are as follows:
IBJ -190 billion yen
NCB RESEARCH INSTITUTE -19 billion yen
DAIWA BANK RESEARCH 10.1 billion yen
SALOMON BROTHERS 10 billion yen
YAMAICHI RESEARCH 48 billion yen
NIKKO RESEARCH 50 billion yen
MERRILL LYNCH JAPAN 67 billion yen
DKB RESEARCH 70 billion yen
OKASAN 125 billion yen
BZW 150 billion yen
